channel.title: Comments on: Superb fix for high DPI problems with Notes and Windows

item.title: By: Mooz80
item.dc:creator: Mooz80
item.description: <p>Hi,<br/>Just to let you know, this guy made my day:<br/>http://www.polymorph.co.uk/content/blog-posts/fix-for-lotus-notes-display-issues-on-surface-pro-high-dpi/<br/>This is the only thing that worked for me, I needed to share!</p>
item.content:encoded:
Hi,
Just to let you know, this guy made my day:
http://www.polymorph.co.uk/content/blog-posts/fix-for-lotus-notes-display-issues-on-surface-pro-high-dpi/
This is the only thing that worked for me, I needed to share!

item.title: By: Mooz80
item.dc:creator: Mooz80
item.description: <p>I installed the 9.0.1 FP5 and it is a little better, but the SameTime client is unusable.<br/>I'm not able to make the manifest trick work... tried with multiple .exe files and not effects on Notes or Sametime. Did somebody came up with a trick that works?</p> <p>Thanks</p>
item.content:encoded:
I installed the 9.0.1 FP5 and it is a little better, but the SameTime client is unusable.
I’m not able to make the manifest trick work… tried with multiple .exe files and not effects on Notes or Sametime. Did somebody came up with a trick that works?

Thanks

item.title: By: Andrew Gr
item.dc:creator: Andrew Gr
item.description: <p>IBM Notes/Des/Admin 9.0.1 FP6 - the solution didn't help. Tried everything possible, almost with all exe-files. No effect. Also tried to pass java param (sun.java2d.dpiaware=false) to JVM - didn't get any success (probably even with passing param to Notes JVM)...<br/>So Designer and Administrator still look ugly...<br/>Any ideas on this so far???<br/>Craig Wiseman, is it any from IBM on your ticket?<br/>Thanks!</p>
item.content:encoded:
IBM Notes/Des/Admin 9.0.1 FP6 – the solution didn’t help. Tried everything possible, almost with all exe-files. No effect. Also tried to pass java param (sun.java2d.dpiaware=false) to JVM – didn’t get any success (probably even with passing param to Notes JVM)…
So Designer and Administrator still look ugly…
Any ideas on this so far???
Craig Wiseman, is it any from IBM on your ticket?
Thanks!

item.title: By: Matt White

In reply to <a href="/2016-1-8-superb-fix-for-high-dpi-problems-with-notes-and-windows/#comment-18">Fredrik Norling</a>.
<p>I added it to notes.exe</p>
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Fredrik Norling.

I added it to notes.exe

item.title: By: Fredrik Norling

item.description: <p>What exe file should this be added to ?</p>
item.content:encoded: What exe file should this be added to ?

item.title: By: Matt Key
item.dc:creator: Matt Key
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2016-1-8-superb-fix-for-high-dpi-problems-with-notes-and-windows/#comment-22">Matt White</a>.
<p>Cheers Matt, I'll recheck what I've done but i wonder if it doesn't work for sametime anyway</p>
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Matt White.

Cheers Matt, I’ll recheck what I’ve done but i wonder if it doesn’t work for sametime anyway

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2016-1-8-superb-fix-for-high-dpi-problems-with-notes-and-windows/#comment-17">Matt Key</a>.
<p>Hi it just worked for me. I don't use same time I'm afraid.</p>
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Matt Key.

Hi it just worked for me. I don’t use same time I’m afraid.

item.title: By: Matt Key
item.dc:creator: Matt Key
item.content:encoded:
Hi Matt,

This didnt really make any difference for me, did you have any trouble getting it to work? I’ve added/updated the manifest file to any notes related exe I could think of. Also I’m mostly interested in the sametime chat window, do you use sametime?

Cheers

item.title: By: Craig Wiseman
item.dc:creator: Craig Wiseman
item.description: <p>This is excellent. I've had a ticket open with IBM on this for 3 months, no progress.</p>
item.content:encoded: This is excellent. I’ve had a ticket open with IBM on this for 3 months, no progress.
